alert.note: Alert for Vance; Warren; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 9:02PM EST until December 19 at 5:30AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Durham, Edgecombe, Franklin, Granville, Halifax, Nash, Orange, Vance, Warren and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 901 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain, which may cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rocky Mount, Chapel Hill, Roanoke Rapids, Henderson, Tarboro, Oxford, Hillsborough, Nashville, Creedmoor, Louisburg, Warrenton, Halifax, Wilson, Carrboro, Butner, Franklinton, Elm City, Norlina and Dortches.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Slow down and use caution to avoid hydroplaning
